column1: good length ball punched off the back foot to long on.
wide sprayed way down leg, lucky not to go for five as Alikhil slightly deflects it and stopped in the end by fine leg in the ring.

sloppy from Rahmat Shah. Short and wide on sixth stump, poor ball but should've been stopped for a dot. Instead Rahmat with a matador effort at point pulling his red cape back while bending right and it slips through to the rope.
googly lands short and spins away from Liton, tapped to point.
good length ball on the stumps, clipped through square leg.
fullish length on off stump, defended on the front foot and the ball square to forward short leg.
good length ball spins sharply into Tamim with some extra bounce. Defended with one hand coming off the bat.
good length ball on fifth stump, left alone as Liton shoulders arms.
good length ball on middle stump, defended to midwicket.

like butter! Short of a length ball on fourth stump, leans back to push this behind point. The ball melts off the bat as Rashid chases in vain. Mujeeb with a slide into the boundary rope for dramatic purposes.
full on leg stump, chipped uppishly but just short of mid-on.
good length ball on fifth stump, Liton chases it with no footwork, ball keeps a touch low to 'oohs' from the crowd.
short of a length on off stump, guided with soft hands off the back foot to third man.
full on off, defended on the front foot.
full on off again, stock off-spinner, defended.
good length ball with a touch more flight at 84 kph/52 mph punched to long-on.
full on off, defended back down the pitch.
short of a length on off stump, Tamim goes back to defend as it spin in, inside edge goes through square leg for a run.
short on fifth stump and spinning in, Liton goes back and clips it with ease through to long-on.
overpitched on off stump, whipped through midwicket, but sluggish outfield slows up the ball 10 yards short of the rope.
good length ball on off stump, defended on the back foot back to Dawlat.
fullish lengh swinging in from off stump line to middle, tentative push forward and the ball flies toward mid-on off one bounce.

short of a length on off stump, prodded toward cover. Tamim thought about a run before shuffling back to his crease and now starts gesturing to Liton at the non-striker's end so they're on the same page.

nearly! Tamim has had trouble keeping the ball on the ground early in his innings. Another drive uppishly toward mid-off but Asghar Afghan is lead-footed and more or less falls over trying to flail his arms at it. Never came close to getting a hand to it whereas a more agile fielder might have created a chance.
beaten! Dawlat pitches this full on fourth stump, it swings away to beat Tamim's attempted drive.
good length ball, spinning away carom ball, defended.

full on off, drives in the air to short cover and Afghanistan are claiming a catch! Watching live I thought it definitely short hopped and Liton is standing his ground. Hashmatullah Shahidi is the fielder. It's 50/50. He lunged forward and the ball lodged in his right hand with his left hand coming off. His head was up high, didn't look at the ball going in to protect his face so he may genuinely not have known if it carried or not. And the third umpire has decided it is OUT! Third umpire is Aleem Dar. The soft signal on field was out and he said he didn't see anything conclusive to overturn on the mic'd up conversation. Those kinds of catches are regularly overturned. It'll generate plenty of debate for sure. It looked awkward at any rate as both hands were not under the ball, just the right one.
full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
goes back to a short ball and flicks to midwicket.
full on off, defended to midwicket.
short on the stumps, clipped to deep midwicket.
short on the stumps, clipped to deep square leg.
short on off, pushed to wide long-off.
good length ball, defended to square leg.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to point.
good length ball on leg stump, clipped behind square leg.
full on off, driven square to backward point.
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square leg, thought about a second but Rahmat denies it running in from the deep.
good length ball on off, goes back to clip to midwicket.
short on off, tapped between cover and point, they set off for a dicey run taking on Shinwari, another weak fielder who throws off balance and drags Alikhil well wide of the stumps.
full on the stumps, tapped gently into midwicket.
full on fourth stump, clipped to midwicket.
short on off, spinning in, fought off to cover.
flighted on a good length on off, goes back to clip behind square.
good length ball angled in, defended to cover off the back foot.
fullish length on off stump sliding into middle, punched off the back foot to cover.
flighted more at 49 mph/78 kph on the stumps, driven to long-off.
good length ball clipped through the leg side.
good length sliding down leg, Shakib goes back to whip off his pads but is late, it deflects off the straps to short fine leg.
good length ball punched to midwicket.
quicker ball darted in flat on leg stump, clipped straight to square leg.
flighted on the stumps, clipped to midwicket.
fullish length on fourth stump, defended on the front foot.
slightly short on the stumps, pulled to Shahidi into the ground at midwicket.
full and angled down leg, Alikhil prevents five wides.
good length ball on middle, punched off the back foot to midwicket.
full on middle, driven to wide long-off.
full on off, reaches forward and pushes this to midwicket.
good length, goes back to push this just wide of Shinwari diving at midwicket, cut off at mid-on.
purring shot. Meow! Short of a length on off, Shakib rocks back to give this ball a scratch behind the ears through backward point. Roars from the Bangladesh fans.
good length ball on middle, pushed to long-off.

full on off, nudged forward to Nabi's right, dives to knock it down but not cleanly and they take off for a run. Shy at the stumps from extra cover charging in and misses with no backup, leads to an overthrow.
full and tapped softly to mid-off, Naib way back on the ring and can't charge in to deny it.
overpitched on middle, clipped past midwicket in the ring, long-on can't deny the second.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended on the back foot down the pitch.
knee high full toss on fourth stump, flicked to long-on.
good length ball on off stump, punched on the back foot to long-on.
good length ball on off, punched back to Mujeeb.
full pitching outside leg stump, flicked with ease behind square.

good length ball angled across Shakib, leading edge balloons awkwardly through point as he aimed for midwicket. No fielder there as the man was pushed back to sweep on the rope and it lands safely for a run.
short of a length pitching outside leg and angled to middle, flicked off the back foot through midwicket.
good length ball on the legs, nudged behind square and Shakib hustles straightaway for a pair with the second completed quite easily.
good length ball angled into the legs, clipped off the pads straight to deep backward square.
good length ball on fifth stump, defended to backward point.
wicked shahp turn! So wicked in fact that it spins past the guidelines outside off, wide called.
flighted on middle and slides on, natural variable turn from Nabi. Defended to midwicket.
short and wide, spins away sharply again, Shakib wanted to slap through cover but too slow and taps it gently to point.
full on off and driven to long-off.
good length on the stumps, clipped off the back foot through midwicket.
good length ball on fourth stump, slapped behind point, Najibullah can't stop this with a sliding effort in the ring, well wide of him in fact.
full outside off, tapped to the off side.

shimmy down the pitch and wham! Tamim has had enough and finally unleashes a flat batted drive to a full ball outside off, bat turns in his hand somewhat as it's not hit cleanly but well enough to race through mid-on.
short of a length on off, guided with an open face to third man.
short on fourth stump, pulled behind square, cut off by deep backward square.
good length ball on fifth stump, guided again to third man.
full on the legs, whipped off the pads behind square.
short on the stumps, help yourself at 125 kph/78 mph. Tamim smokes this pull through midwicket.
good length ball on middle, straightens but Shakib is up to the task defending.
full and very wide, driven to extra cover, diving stop by Shinwari.
good length ball on off, goes back to tap this to square leg.
full on off, Tamim stretches forward to prod this back down the pitch.
slightly short and wide on sixth stump, guided behind point.
good length ball with plenty of pace off, Tamim holds the hands back to guide it to backward point again, not wide enough for a run.
short on the legs, tapped behind square off the back foot.
googly, full and defended.
short on off, defended on the back foot.
fullish length on fourth stump, googly spins past Tamim's forward prod.
googly pitching outside leg, goes back to flick to midwicket but not wide enough for a run.
flighted full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
fullish length on fifth stump, guided in front of point.
good length ball on fourth stump, punched off the back foot to long-off.
good length on fifth stump, punched to extra cover.
full on off, defended to midwicket.
too short on the legs, and cranked through midwicket. Sweeper with no chance.

castled! Nabi with the rope a dope the ball before floating up a sucker ball to get Tamim on the back foot, this time zips one in slightly quicker and flatter on a good to fullish length at 82 kph/51 mph, Tamim into the habit of consistently going onto the back foot when he should've come forward for this, this one skids on from fourth stump line to crash into off stump, beating the back foot slap. Bangladesh momentum arrested temporarily.

double-strike for Afghanistan! Rashid gets a good length ball pitching on middle stump to straighten and skid on but Shakib calls for the review! Looked stone dead live. Hit on the knee roll with Shakib striding a touch forward. And ball-tracking shows it's going over the stumps on height! Great review by Shakib. Is there any doubt that this is his tournament?
full and spinning down leg. Wide called.
good length ball on the legs, clipped through midwicket.
good length ball pushed to the off side.
full and wide, left alone.
full on off, defended on the front foot.
googly spinning in from off stump on a good length, punched through the off side to cover sweeper.
full and wide outside off, touch of swing as Mushfiqur chases at this, beaten badly. Almost called wide on the line.
short and wide, cut behind point to the sweeper.
fullish length on off, defended into the ground.
full on middle, driven to midwicket.
fullish length angled across fourth stump, defended to point.
bouncer angled down leg, called a wide more on line than height as the ball didn't really bounce much, just passed Shakib ducking.
good length ball angled across, guided into the ground just wide of slip, Nabi, intentional shot. Asghar Afghan on the rope stops it at third man from being four.
full outside off, leans in and drives with the turn to long-off
full on off, driven to long-on
short of a length and just outside off, stays inside the line and delicately pokes this past slip with an open face. That ball went straight on
length on off stump, pushed through cover off the front foot
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
full on leg stump, flicked to deep square
length and just outside off, stabs away from the body and gets this to mid-off who is under sufficient pressure to put in a stray throw. Overthrows
short of a length and slanted in at the hips. Uses the angle to glance to fine leg
short and just outside off, gets back and rolls his wrists over this pull shot to deep square's left
thick edge as this swings away late in the corridor. He looks to flick but his feet are rooted and he isn't close to it. Flies down to third man
short and wide outside off, left alone
slower ball at a length just outside off, looks to drive and gets an edge that rolls out to the keeper
length and in at leg stump, flicked to deep square
full and just outside off, driven to long-on
short of a length and turning in outside off, under-edges a late cut to backward point's left. He sprints and dives, gets a hand on it, but not a clean stop
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
full outside off, looks to drive and gets a thick outside edge to sweeper's left
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length on leg stump, tickled to short fine off the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped to mid-on's right
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man's left
short and wide, allows it to come on and chops to sweeper's right
beaten. Short and wide outside off, looks to cut but this jumps up off the surface to beat the outside edge
top edge goes over the keeper. Short and wide outside off, similar to last ball. Jumps up again. But this time he's looked to pull and has closed the face on this
short of a length in the corridor, chopped to third man's right and a misfield allows the second
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
length and turning away from off. Looks to flick, can't get enough power on it
short at middle stump, gets deep in the crease and pulls to deep square
short and just outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
nicely placed. Length and pushed flat outside off. Decent ball against a straight bat. Mushfiqur has come down and swept it though. Before it can turn, and well in front of square
edged but no slip now. Length ball pushed across off stump, slight curve away. Played with soft hands though and gets a second to third man's right
short and wide outside off, cut straight to point
slapped back past the bowler. But it's a long boundary and long-on cleans up to his right. This attempted legbreak is dug in short and he has plenty of time to get back and flat-bat it
full on leg stump, flicked between fine leg and deep square
length on middle stump, punched on the up to long-on
slower ball at a length on middle. Plants the front leg across and flicks to fine leg
beats the inside edge and the keeper! Gorgeous old-fashioned offbreak. Drifts away, lands on a length and cuts back to beat the gap between bat and pad
full on middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right...and a fairly straightforward take is misfielded
length on leg stump, clipped straight to short fine
length at off stump, opens the face and pokes this to cover's right
short of a length just outside off, sliced to short third
length at middle stump, quicker than usual. Hurriedly pushed to short fine off the inside half
length and just outside off, tapped on the rise to mid-off
length and just outside off, chopped straight to point on the up
length outside off, looks to drive on the up, gets it off the bottom part of the bat to mid-off
length in the corridor, flicked to midwicket
length and just outside off, driven on the up to point
short of a length just outside off, punched back down the pitch and it is a maiden
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and just outside off, shuffles to flick but is forced to push it down the pitch
length on middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length outside off, pushed to extra cover's right with soft hands

another fifty. Fifth 50-plus score of the tournament for Shakib. Length ball angled in, pushes with hard hands and finds the single off the thick inside edge at square leg. What a tournament he's having
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
overpitched outside off, driven straight to extra cover
inside edge as this curves back furiously from outside off. Full and he wants to drive again. Foot is planted right across the stumps. Would have been in serious trouble against a quicker bowler
length on middle, punched to long-on on the up
short and wide outside off, cut to point
slower ball at a length on off, leans in and tucks this to short fine's left off the front foot
legcutter, back of a length and just outside off. Flicks to midwicket's left off the back foot
length at middle, shuffles and clips through square leg off the front foot

he's got him! Shakib not reviewing. Length ball skids past the inside edge as he gets forward and raps him in front of middle stump. Was that angling down? Could have been, but Shakib doesn't think so. And he's right, replays confirm. Walks straight off. Mujeeb has done it. He has quietly had a very good World Cup. Today he's made an opening. Shakib was playing for the offbreak, this cut back in
length and in at middle stump, defended on the front foot
beaten. Plays for the one coming in, this skids straight on past the outside edge
length at off stump, punched back to the bowler
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length at off stump, drops it towards square leg with soft hands
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
length and in at off stump, defended into the covers

run out appeal sent upstairs. Direct hit at the non-striker's end...he's just in. Whew. Rather lazy effort from Sarkar at grounding the bat, but he's in by a frame or two. Had tapped this on the rise to mid-on with soft hands
overpitched outside off and a sweet connection on this expansive cover drive. But it's straight to sweeper cover
length outside off, hangs the bat out and stabs to third man's right. It's a poor throw and Sarkar makes it back for the second
length outside off, pushed towards to the non-striker
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
short of a length on middle stump, gets deep in the crease and pulled to long-on's right
full on middle stump, flicked down to long-on
beaten on the flick as this is a googly. Bowled with the wrist so he expects a legbreak, but he's beaten outside off

lbw decision review by Sarkar. He's caught right in front of middle to a full ball, trying to flick it. It's a legbreak this time. Has it done enough to miss leg? The stump is half visible on the early replay...and tracking says it is clipping it. Umpire's call. Bangladesh retain their review, but they've lost Sarkar - who already looked quite lost at No. 5. Liton was probably pushed up today to counter Mujeeb, and we've seen why
full at middle stump, driven firmly back to the bowler
length in the corridor, opens the face, runs it down to third man
beaten. Length and wide outside off. Looks to drive with front leg far away from the pitch of the ball
short and wide outside off, thick edge down to third man as he looks to cut
length outside off, square drive straight to point
length and in at middle stump, defended solidly on the back foot
good length ball on fourth stump and straightening, defended to the off side.
short on off, tapped off the back foot through the covers.
flighted full at 90 kph/56 mph, driven through wide long-off, but not wide enough for a second.
googly spinning in off a fullish length from fourth stump, defended on the front foot and an edge squirts to short third man.

good length ball clipped to midwicket off the back foot. Mushfiqur turned and wanted two but doesn't see that Mahmudullah is limping to the non-striker's end for the first run. He's hobbling quite badly in fact and is down on the ground now as the physio rushes out to work on his right calf. Cramping up five balls after the drinks break. Hmm...
good length ball pitching on leg, Mushfiqur goes back to clip behind square.
full on middle, whipped through the leg side for one.

good length ball prodded to cover, Mahmudullah hobbles out of his crease looking for a run. Mushfiqur wasn't going to risk selling himself out for a partner on one leg. Shinwari fields in the ring and spins to fire wildly past the stumps with Mahmudullah well in. The line of the throw makes it impossible for a back-up fielder to be in position and they steal an overthrow.
fullish length on fifth stump line, Mushfiqur goes to drive through cover, inside edge thuds into his feet.
good length ball on middle stump, defended to extra cover.
short of a length with width on fifth stump line, opens the face to run it to third man.
short but well outside off on sixth stump line, Mahmudullah drags a pull through wide midwicket.
good length ball on middle, defended off the back foot to Rashid.
short on fifth stump and straightening, slapped off the back foot to point sweeper.
googly lands short spinning in from sixth stump line, easily read off the pitch and tapped behind point.
flighted full on off at 86 kph/53 mph, defended on the front foot.
fuller and zippier on middle at 92 kph, defended back to Rashid.
good length ball lands on off stump line and spins sharply to beat a flat footed fishing reel poke from Mahmudullah.
short of a length ball on middle angled into the hips, Mushfiqur can't flick it away off the thigh.
hello! 50 up for Mushfiqur, and how! Mushfiqur breaks the boundary-less streak after 73 balls with a shuffle down the pitch to heave a length ball over long-on.
fullish length on off stump, guided fine to third man.
offcutter angled in from off stump, hops back to nurdle this to third man.
slower bouncer on the body, Mushfiqur cramped for room trying to uppercut and beaten. The ball bounces before Alikhil behind the stumps.
full on off, driven to mid-off, tumbling stop moving left saves it from being four.
fullish length on fourth stump, driven in the air, not in control of it, but well wide of cover as it dribbles toward the sweeper.
full and defended toward cover.
flighted full on off, pushes for a run in front of point before a gimpy hobble for the non-striker's end.
quicker ball darted in at 96 kph/60 mph on off stump, defended to point.
full, quicker ball down leg, well stopped by Alikhil.
short of a length ball on middle, goes back to tuck behind square.
full on middle, driven to long-on.
googly on a fullish length spinning back from fourth stump, punched off the back foot through cover.

fullish length on fourth stump, swept in front of midwicket and they sneak a second taking on Mujeeb's from deep midwicket. Awful relay, even worse backup by Shinwari who has been poor all day in the field and Mahmudullah shockingly pinches not just the second but also an overthrow. Village from Afghanistan.
good length ball, spins past a back foot slap.
good length ball on the stumps, pushed to the cover sweeper.
flighted very full on leg stump, pushed straight to midwicket.

glorious from Mushfiqur! Shuffled outside off stump seeing fine leg up in the ring to create the angle to sweep this very fine. Rashid bowled this on fifth stump and Mushfiqur continues with the sweep getting it fine through fine leg.
good length ball on off, no footwork, edged to point.
short on off, cut behind point to the sweeper.
short on off, flighted at 74 kph/46 mph, plenty of time to go back and cut through point.
Sumptuous! Short on fourth stump, back foot swat over cover in the ring. Timed well enough to beat cover sweeper and long-off converging.
good length ball on the legs, clipped to fine leg in the ring.
quicker and fuller on off stump at 92 kph/57 mph, pushed through point.
Shot of the day! A fraction of width offered by Gulbadin on a good length, square drive by Mahmudullah beats Najibullah's dive at backward point.
slower ball on fifth stump, Mahmudullah waves over it. Bounces several times before reaching Alikhil.
another slower ball this time on off stump, pushed to Najibullah at backward point who denies the thought of a run.
slower short ball on the legs at 100 kph/62 mph, keeps the hands back to paddle pull to long leg.
short ball on the stumps at normal pace, pulled behind square. Mujeeb circles around from long leg to flick to Rashid coming over from deep midwicket to turn four into two.
slower ball lands very full on off, chipped uppishly just short of short midwicket.
good length ball spinning in, punched to cover.
flighted full on leg stump, clipped straight to the man at 45.
short on the stumps at 86 kph and spinning in, fought off to the left of Nabi who denies a single.

short on fifth stump, slapped straight to cover on one bounce but a frankly awful misfield by Gulbadin turns a dot into two as the ball scurries toward the sweeper. Didn't try to get any of his body behind it. Another Matador red cape effort in the field pulling the hands back.
fullish length on fifth stump, guided behind point to the sweeper.
full on the stumps, clipped to midwicket. Sliding stop by Shahidi.
slower ball lands on a length on sixth stump, Mahmudullah with a premeditated shuffle flays this over cover to the sweeper.
slower ball on off, Mushfiqur goes back to cross bat a slog for long-on, not remotely close to timing it to carry to Noor Ali on as a sub.
low full toss at ankle height on sixth stump line, driven square to the sweeper.
slower ball on a length, keeps the hands back to cut behind point at 96 kph/60 mph.
yorker bowled at full pace on fifth stump beats another charge. Good work by Gulbadin mixing up his pace to keep the Bangladesh pair off balance.

another slower ball does the trick! Full marks to Gulbadin for the constant variations which stymied both batsmen this over. This one lands on a good length on the stumps but Mahmudullah's timing is off trying to charge and he mistimes a pull straight to Nabi five yards in from the ring at midwicket, taken at thigh height while crouching his left knee on the turf.
good length on fourth stump, premeditated shuffle across to scoop over the wicketkeeper, but gets it square to the man at 45 in the ring.
good length ball guided with soft hands and an open face fine past the keeper, Nabi with a clumsy effort at short third man diving over the top of the ball allows one to turn into three.
flighted full on fourth stump, defended to point.
very full on off, defended.
googly on fourth stump spinning in, beaten defending forward but it looked like he was struck on the pads outside the line of off stump.
flighted full on fifth stump, defended on the front foot to point.
full on off, defended.
goes for the reverse sweep to a full ball on middle, connects over backward point for a pair, didn't get the power to reach the rope.

good length ball spinning in sharply follows Mushfiqur backing away, punched through to the sweeper as they saunter back for a pair. Direct hit from the boundary at the non-striker's end but Mosaddek well in.
short on fifth stump and spinning in, slapped wide of the sweeper for another pair.
flighted full on middle, clipped through midwicket.
flighted full on middle, strides forward to block and an inside edge trickles to short fine leg.
full on off, clipped through midwicket with soft hands, they scamper a pair as the ball trickles through the ring with no one fielding in the on side in the circle.

full on off, tries to flick through midwicket again with no fielders in the on side ring, leading edge balloons toward extra cover, Gulbadin slow to react running forward, lunges as the ball lands short and goes under him for a pair. Microcosm of Afghanistan's fielding all day. Consistently a step too slow.
flighted full and very wide, left alone pulling the bat back.
flighted very full on fifth stump, pushed to long on.
googly follows Mushfiqur backing away, picks out cover on the ring.
premeditated scoop to a fullish ball pitching on middle, clears the keeper but not enough pace on it to reach the rope.
short ball sits up at 126 kph/78 mph, swatted with a pirouette through wide long-on.
yorker on fifth stump zips under Mosaddek's drive at 132 kph/82 mph.
attempted slower ball yorker, got the length right but misfired horribly on the line down leg at 114 kph. Wide called.

slower ball at 113 kph lands on a fullish length, scorching drive just evades Dawlat's hand falling left, not enough pace on the ball to get to the rope and it's knocked back at long-off by long-on moving across, Nabi. Good effort to save one there.
bouncer on off stump line, Mushfiqur beaten for pace going to pull.
slower ball on off stump at 112 kph out of the back of the hand. Mushfiqur swings and misses but tennis ball spongy bounce takes the ball over the stumps before bouncing short of Alikhil.

another slower ball lands on middle stump on a fullish length, Mushfiqur shuffles across to paddle this and gets a faint inside edge into this legs as the ball dies a foot in front of the stumps. Mosaddek beats Dawlat in a foot race to the striker's end.
reverse sweep! Didn't quite time this well but went for the elevation and he barely clears Hashmatullah doing a salmon leap/dive at short third man.
short on fifth stump, cut to the sweeper.
very full on off stump, Mosaddek backs away to create room to loft over cover, super elegant.
good length ball, goes to reverse and is struck in front of leg stump line backing away. Afghanistan opt not to review.
backs away again to a googly, misses a drive beaten through the gate.
flighted very full on fifth stump, whipped through midwicket but not wide enough of the boundary rider to come back for two.

really wretched fielding from Afghanistan continues. Poor ball to be honest as it was a low full toss at shin height on fourth stump but Nabi with a tame effort in the covers doing another Matador cape with his arms and it beats long-off coming across too.
another misfired yorker, but this one at ankle height on middle stump this time around so no width to drive, and a single is pushed to long-off.

Mushfiqur's superb effort ends with a skier to Nabi at extra cover! It was in the slot full outside off, just got under it way too much trying to clear the off side ring. Goes high to Nabi backpedaling from the circle and he takes it safely. Mushfiqur has set up Bangladesh beautifully on a track offering plenty of turn. Every run valuable on what is expected to be a tough chasing track used for a second match.
short and going down leg, should have been one pulled to long leg by Mujeeb with a sloppy fumble turns one into two.
slower ball lands full on middle stump, smokes a drive straight to mid-off on the ring, Asghar Afghan.
full on fifth stump, lofted in the air well short of long-off.
picture perfect yorker on middle stump at 122 kph/76 mph, dug out to mid off.

dropped! Frankly embarrassing from Dawlat. The same man who dropped Eoin Morgan on 26 on the boundary off Rashid in the England match produces the worst effort of the day - and there are plenty to choose from across these 50 overs. Gorgeous slower ball from Gulbadin landing wide outside off is sliced softly in the air to backward point. Dawlat runs to his right in front of Asghar moving left from short third man. He spills a dolly at head height. 2/10 on degree of difficulty.
slower ball lands full on off stump, keeps the hands back and drills through extra cover, Rashid charging across from long-off can't slap it back in.
slower ball on off, edge sliced to short third man.
slower ball lands on a length wide outside off, slapped to long off.

slower ball yorker finally rewarded! It was loopy at 99 kph/61 mph. Mosaddek backed away to carve over the off side but couldn't time this trying to swat over the top of it as the ball fell off a table. Toe edge drags the ball onto off stump.
length ball just outside off, defended into the covers
length ball onto the pads, looks to flick and deflects it fine off the thigh
length ball just outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, allows that to come on flicks late. Gets it well in front of square
length ball down leg side, can't get bat on the flick
full and in at off stump. Looks to drive but jams the bat on it and it trickles back to the bowler
length and just outside off, defended into the off side
length and swung into the pads. Looks to flick and can't get bat on it. Just above the flap, the contact. Lbw turned down. Pitched outside leg too
length and a bit of wobble outside off. Mistimed drive on the rise to mid-off
length on middle stump, defended solidly off the back foot
length outside off, looks to drive on the up but it rolls out to extra cover off the high part of the bat
length on the pads, gets on top to glance. Deflected fine off the thigh guard
short of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
run-out appeal at the non-striker's end. Keeper dives down leg side and parries it as he looks to collect a wide. A throw comes in and Mashrafe takes off the bauls, but the bat is grounded
length at leg stump, clipped through square leg off the back foot
length at off stump, looks to open the face and gets an inside edge to midwicket's right
length ball in the corridor, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to mid-on's right
past the inside edge. Offcutter cuts back from a length in the corridor as he looks to waft at it
length ball just outside off, punched back past the bowler off the back foot. Nice, high elbow on this as he got behind the line
length ball swung in at leg stump. Looks to whip it off the back foot, deflected off the outside part of the pad
length at off stump, blocked solidly on the front foot
short of a length and wide outside off. Left alone
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
nailed. Lovely balance from Rahmat. Short ball wide outside off. Pivots on the back foot and rolls the wrists to pull this to the square leg boundary
length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on leg stump, chipped to deep square leg
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length and just outside off, defended off the back foot
length ball outside off, blocked on the front foot
length outside off. Looks to punch on the rise but this comes off the inside half of the bat
beats the outside edge. Offcutter from a good length, draws him forward and rips it past the attempted forward block
length on off stump, neatly punched on the up, but can't beat mid-off to his right
short of a length just outside off, opens the face and guides this to third man
length and just outside off, defended to mid-off on the front foot
just gets to the boundary. A wild swipe from Gulbadin, but he gets it past mid-off. Full ball outside off, gets the front leg out of the way and slices from under
length on off stump, defended off the back foot
just past midwicket. Length ball climbing into him at leg stump. Leans and flicks uppishly. Deep square gets around to his left
length on leg stump, rapped on the thigh guard as he looks to flick
lifted wide of mid-on. Length ball on middle, steps out and swings across the line. Floats wide off the inside half
length on middle stump, wants to punch this straight back but is hurried. Off the inside half to mid-on
length on middle, flicked on the rise to midwicket
length on leg stump, looks to flick, gets a leading edge to point
short on leg stump, whipped to deep square's right
full and in at middle stump, looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge to square leg's left. That swung in late
slower ball at a length outside off, punched on the up to extra cover
length on leg stump, can't get this whip past short fine
length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
short and down leg side, gets his weight into the off side and makes room to swipe this to the long leg boundary. Gets it there with ease
beauty. Length at off stump. Rahmat offers the full face to try and drive back down the ground, but this straightens and beats him
length outside off, opens the face and gets it down to third man
clears mid-on. Off the low part of the bat with this attempted lofted drive. Full on middle and he just can't get the swing away
shot! Length and some width outside off. Gets nicely on top of the bounce and punches past point off the back foot
length on middle, pushed back into the non-striker's stumps
length on the pads, whipped to deep square's right
length on middle stump, punched firmly on the up but straight to mid-on
short and wide outside off, looks to cut and is beaten
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle, tucked into the square leg area off the back foot
length outside off, driven back to the bowler off the toe-end
length outside off, some turn, but he manages to drive on the up to long-off
short of a length outside off, chopped to extra cover's left
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on off stump, steps out and slices to extra cover's left

taken at mid-on. That is a soft dismissal for Afghanistan's best player. Length ball skids on with the arm at off stump. He looks to pull uppishly with the front leg in the leg side. Ends up slicing weakly for the fielder tracking back there
full outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg off the back foot
length on leg stump, flicked to square leg
length outside off, leans in, opens the face and runs this wide of short third man
length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed through quicker. Defended hurriedly into the leg side
length at off stump, nudged into the leg side off the back foot
length on middle stump, defended off the inside half to midwicket
length outside off, pushed to short third man's right off the front foot
length on middle stump, tapped to midwicket
full on middle stump, jammed back towards the non-striker
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length on middle stump, pushed down the pitch on the front foot
length on middle stump, gets forward and flicks into the leg side
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
full on middle stump, flicked to mid-on where Mashrafe falls over as he tries to field and release the ball quickly. That was a run out chance if he'd got it in his grasp
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
length on middle, driven down to long-on
beaten. Short of a length and drifting in at off stump from around the wicket. Grips and spins past the back foot defence
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
full on off stump, defended to extra cover on the front foot
length at off stump, hurriedly taps it back to the bowler
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket's right
length on middle, pushed to midiwicket off the back foot
lifted over mid-off. Once again not the best connection, but there's enough to get what he needs - a boundary. Full outside off, steps out and goes against the turn. Off the low part of the bat
length outside off, defended into the covers
short of a length just outside off, chopped to point off the back foot
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off, gets low and sweeps along the floor to deep square
length on off stump, defended to midwicket's left
length on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right from deep in the crease
fullish length on middle spinning to leg, flicked through midwicket for a tight run.
flighted on a good length on fifth stump, punched to cover.
flighted full on off, tried to tip and run through point but Mehidy hares in to deny the single.
full and driven through to long-off.
flighted at 93 kph/58 mph on middle with sharp dip, clipped through to deep midwicket.
edged! No slip in place or he would have gobbled it up. Flighted full on fifth stump, Hashmatullah reaches forward to drive, thick edge goes past Mushfiqur to third man.
flighted on fourth stump, no turn, driven down the pitch past Mehidy's dive to long-on.
good length ball skids on from fourth stump line, defended to point.
full on fourth stump, sweeps behind square, misfield on the rope by Sabbir Rahman on as a sub for Mahmudullah allows a third.
very full on middle, driven to midwicket in the ring.
fullish on middle, whipped wide of midwicket in the ring, work to do for the man on the rope coming in circling around.
full on fourth stump, flicked across the line through square leg.
nervy flick to a good length ball spinning onto middle stump, in the air for a while but three yards wide of midwicket in the ring.
flighted full on off, defended back to Mosaddek.
flighted on a good length on fourth stump, Hashmatullah caught flat footed unsure to go forward or back and chops into the ground toward point.
Hashmatullah handcuffed again with no footwork on a good length ball outside off, mistimes again through point.
this time gets the line tighter on off to middle, Hashmatullah with a smidgen of footwoork moving back to stab this out. Mosaddek thought he might have snuck this through.
full on off, driven back to Mosaddek.
flighted on a good length on fourth stump, driven off the back foot through cover.
flighted full on off, driven to long-off.
flighted full on off, driven to long-on.
darted in on a good length drifting into leg stump, goes back to clip through to deep midwicket.
angled across the batsman on off, defended.
angled again full on off stump, flicked to midwicket.
speared in flatter and short outside off to negate Hashmatullah's telegraphed charge, he checks with a cut to point.

should've been a runout! Hashmatullah chopped a short ball well wide of cover for what should have been an easy run after the ball was only partially knocked down by Liton Das at extra cover and squirted well away for a run. Both he and Gulbadin stopped midpitch to admire the scenery on the boundary. Mehidy backs up the misfield from point with Gulbadin still halfway down the pitch after Hashmatullah ran back. But he rushed the throw to Mosaddek over the stumps and dragged him two yards away to reprieve Gulbadin. An accurate relay would have had him out by 3 yards. Mosaddek is furious at Mehidy.
full on leg, clipped through midwicket.
full on off, driven through extra cover, slight misfield and mid-off cleans up.

lovely flight and lovely stumping! Hashmatullah had itchy feet from the start of the over with a series of premeditated shuffles down the pitch. He got the itch again tempted out with a well flighted ball that was dragged slightly back and slightly wider on a fifth stump line. Hashmatullah doesn't cover the line and is beaten by the turn. Sharp work by Mushfiqur to whip the bails off with Hashmatullah's back foot flailing about three inches short of getting back in.
short of a length on fourth stump, spooned short of midwicket off the back foot.
full on middle, driven to long-on.
flighted full angled across on fifth stump, driven to mid-off. Hesitation for a run.
full on the legs, clipped to fine leg.
full on middle, pushed back to Mehidy.
good length on the legs, clipped to square leg.

nearly a wicket! Flighted full on off, Gulbadin tried to flick across to midwicket. Leading edge ballooned up to Mehidy's left but he had to negotiate getting around Asghar at the non-striker's end, who held his ground. If he wasn't in the way, would've been a far easier attempt. Instead he never got a hand to it.
full and clipped to square leg.
sweeps a ball off middle stump to deep backward square.
uses his feet to a fullish length ball spinning into his legs, beaten in flight but continues through the shot and chips it over mid-off against the turn. Bold shot.
short on off, keeps low spinning in and slugged across the line along the ground to long-on.
good length ball on off, defended into the ground as Asghar tries to kick it around from Mushfiqur. A ruthless keeper might have appealed for obstructing the field there and won it!
yorker length quicker ball on middle dug out to the bowler.
sweeps a fullish ball off leg stump, can't keep it down and it's in the air for awhile but lands 10 yards short of deep backward square.
goes for the paddle sweep to a full ball on fourth stump, clears the keeper and goes fine for a pair through fine leg.
flat and full on fourth stump, defended on the front foot to square leg.
very full ball on fifth stump met by Asghar reaching a long way forward to sweep, Asghar smothers this through square leg.
full on off stump, thought about sweeping it before checking with a prod forward that squirts to square leg.
full on off, driven to long-on.
flighted full on off, defended on the front foot.
flighted very full on fourth stump, pushed back to Shakib on the front foot.
fullish length on fourth stump, driven to long-off.
flighted full on fourth stump, skids on and defended back to Shakib.
flighted on middle, Asghar took a step down the pitch before stopping and defending toward cover.

full again on off, nudges an inside edge to square leg. Mushfiqur bolts from behind the stumps to field, spin and fire at the non-striker's end but way wide of the stumps and Asghar was in regardless.
short of a length ball on off, Asghar goes back to clip through the leg side.

charges the bowler who responds with a full ball on middle, driven hard into the pitch and bounces in the air toward Saifuddin's outstretched right palm in his follow-through. Umpire Michael Gough has to swerve dramatically to avoid a carom that goes to long-on.
knee high full toss on off stump at 128 kph/79 mph, punched straight back to the bowler. Missed boundary ball.
fullish length slower ball on fifth stump, at 111 kph/69 mph, checks a drive to point.
good length ball angled in from fourth stump, goes back to flick through midwicket.

full toss on the thigh, should have disappeared for four at a minimum, maybe even six. But Afghanistan batsmen bogged down mentally at the moment and Gulbadin misses a flick off the thigh guard that ricochets to short fine leg.
uses his feet immediately with the new man placed under the helmet, only manages to punch back to Shakib.
uses his feet again to push back to Shakib.
flighted full on off, defended awkardly playing around his pads.
flighted full on middle, defended again.
flighted full but a touch wider on fourth stump, goes to drive and squirts to backward point.
flighted on off, drives to extra cover. The presence alone of silly point is enough to spark a maiden.
takes a step down the track to meet a fullish length ball pitching on fifth stump to drag wide through midwicket, slight misfield ensures the run.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended to point.
yorker on middle, well dug out by Asghar to long-on.
fullish length tailing into off stump, slog across the line nubbed to midwicket. Pressure starting to show with release shots in this over.
short of a length ball on off, defended to cover.
another attempted yorker is an ankle high full toss on fifth stump, driven back to Saifuddin. Crowd roars thinking it's a catch but reality is a bump ball.

brilliant field placing captaincy by Mashrafe! They had a man at short mid-off a little while ago and Liton was moved a touch wider at short extra cover at about 17 yards. The ball has been stopping a touch on this pitch all day with flicks and drives going slightly uppish in the ring and on this occasion Gulbadin laces a flat drive to Liton, who claims a catch at ankle height crouching slightly forward. Shakib erupts, as does the partisan Bangladesh crowd! 8/10 on degree of difficulty due to the pace it came at Liton from short range but it was straight to him on line.
reaches forward to defend a full ball on off.

Bangladesh's king of the tourney castles the President of Afghanistan! It was a beauty flighted on fourth stump and skidded on with Nabi's technique exposed. He gave a half-hearted stride forward prodding with a gap between bat and pad. The ball clips the inside edge before ricocheting onto leg stump. Shakib is rocking this tournament!
goes for the reverse sweep immediately paddling a ball off middle stump to third man.
full on fifth stump, pushed to cover.
very full on fourth stump, driven to cover.
full on fourth stump, driven with a firm bounce off the pitch over Saifuddin, past mid-off and cut off by long-on coming across.
slower bouncer on fifth stump, left alone and short hops Mushfiqur, who flubs the take and it goes off his pads toward fine leg for a bye.
good length ball on fourth stump, Shinwari pushes to cover for a kamikaze single but is rightly sent back by Asghar.
overpitched on middle, driven square to the cover sweeper.
fullish length ball on middle, clipped to square leg.
fullish length ball on sixth stump, attacked the width but is beaten for pace past the outside edge.
good length ball angled in from middle stump to leg, punched straight back to Shakib but he gets a bit slack bending over to field and it goes through his hands for a stolen single to mid-off.
good length ball on sixth stump, plays well away from his body defending.
quicker ball bowled flatter on off, prods an edge to square leg but Mushfiqur hurries out from behind to deny a single.
fullish length on fifth stump, defended back to Shakib.
good length ball on off, defended on the back foot back to Shakib moving left to cut it off.
good length ball on middle, goes back in his crease to flick through midwicket.
short of a length on the hips, clipped wide of short fine leg.
good length on fourth stump, pushed through cover.
good length ball on the hips, clipped straight to perfectly positioned Mustafizur at short fine leg.
full and very wide outside off, driven firmly but straight to extra cover.
short of a length on fifth stump, goes back to tap into short midwicket. An unnecessary throw by Shakib at the non-striker's stumps hits and ricochets through extra cover for an overthrow.
slower ball at 116 kph/72 mph on off stump on a good length clipped off the back foot through square leg.
good length ball on fourth stump, defended on the back foot to cover as Shinwari trails too far out of the non-striker's end but the relay back wasn't close to being in time.

Shakib you monster! Asghar was bogged down and looked desperate to get off strike previous ball. He shuffles back and forth side to side across the crease as Shakib approached this time and finally stopped moving with his feet outside leg stump as Shakib floated one full on middle. Asghar goes for the slog sweep as a release shot in frustration, too much elevation and not enough distance. Basic catch taken at waist height 8 yards in from the rope.
full and on off, clipped to square leg.
full on the stumps, driven to long-on.
floated very full on middle, dug out to mid-on.
floated on fourth stump on a good length, pushed behind point.
short of a length on middle, tapped off the back foot into midwicket.
short on off, punched to cover.
slower ball angled into the legs, clipped gently through square leg, too much work for the man coming off the rope to deny the second.
short angled across off stump, cut straight to point.
angled across on fourth stump line on a good length, punched off the back foot well wide of the cover sweeper.
fullish length on leg stump, nudged into short midwicket.
good length ball on fourth stump angled in, defended to point off the back foot.
short of a length at 133 kph/83 mph, hustles Alikhil who defends awkwardly to point again.
fullish length but angled down leg at 134 kph/83 mph.
yorker length ball on sixth stump, poked out to extra cover.
low full toss at ankle height on fourth stump, flubbed off the toe end of the bat but wide of extra cover.
short of a length on the legs, goes back to clip through square leg.
fullish length ball on fifth stump, Alikhil goes forward to drive, thick edge goes wide of Mushfiqur for Afghanistan's first boundary in more than 11 overs.

appeal for lbw is turned down, appeal for run-out is sent upstairs. He was looking to flick this length ball from middle stump and deflected it into the leg side...and Ikram has made a lazy attempt to get back in at the non-striker's end. Just plonks it in and the direct hit has caught him short. It was a poor run attempt to start off, but the end could have been so different
length on leg stump, tapped into the leg side from deep in the crease
full on middle stump, gets very low, reaches out, and sweeps this to the long leg boundary with some control
length at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket off the back foot
shot! It is probably one of the tactical errors of the day that this guy is batting at 8. Najib begins by jumping down the track against a length ball and swatting it over mid-on
full on middle stump, reverse sweep finds short point
full and just outside off, jabs it into the covers and calls early for the run
overpitched just outside off, driven to extra cover who stops low to his right
length ball angled down leg, can't get bat to this
length and just outside off. Defended into the covers
length just outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short at leg stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands and he's back for the second
short of a length on leg stump, poked through midwicket with soft hands
length on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket's right
length and just outside off, driven on the up, back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, steps out and crunches this past extra cover after reaching the pitch. Superb feet and timing on this
full on middle stump, drags a reverse sweep between point and short third
short of a length outside off, stabbed to sweeper's left off the back foot
full on off stump, drills this drive into the turf, finds extra cover on the bounce
shot! Is there life yet in this line up? Mustafiz slants one across off stump and Shinwari makes no effort to keep this cut shot down. Wallops to the backward point boundary
length and in at off stump. Watchfully defended back to the bowler
beats him. Trademark cutter at a good length. Shinwari looks to drive through the line without moving his feet
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square with the angle

beaten. Another slower ball. This one dug in short and climbing past the outside edge as he fishes away from the body. Mushfiq gives the bowler a stare. The previous cutter rolled out to him and gave him a bump on the fingers
missed run-out chance, it appears. Najib drops this offcutter into the covers and takes off. Shinwari dives as point swoops down at this and has a shy at the striker's end. Narrowly misses
slower ball at a length outside off, punched on the rise to long-on

yorker tailing in off stump. Jammed on the bounce to extra cover, whose throw at the non-striker's is too quick for Mashrafe backing up at midwicket. Parries it to his right with a dive and they steal a run
full and just outside off, tapped to mid-off on the front foot
goes completely wrong. Attempted slower bouncer. He loses balance as he delivers this and it's way down leg side
lbw appeal turned down. This length ball tails in as he looks to play the scoop. He's struck on the front foot, but impact could be outside off stump. Mashrafe thinks so as well. No review
full on leg stump, neatly driven to long-on's right
tossed up outside off, leans in and drives against the turn to long-off's right
full on leg stump, steps out and can only manage enough room to chip this towards long-on
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
length on middle stump, gets forward and flicks to long-on
beaten. Tossed up outside off, drifting in a touch. Jumps past the edge

no! That can't be possible! Shinwari has closed the face on a ball about to spin past the wide marker without reaching the pitch, and managed to middle that to get it over long-off! He's not a very tall man, so this is just stunning wristwork
slower ball at middle, punched to long-on off the back foot
length at middle stump, gets back in the crease and taps this into the leg side
awayswinging yorker at off. Gently clips this into the vacant leg side and comes back for the second
slower short ball outside off, sliced to short third man's left
full inswinger on the pads. Looks like a thin inside edge onto the front one as he looks to flick
low full toss on middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket

top edge lands safely to short third man's right. This is lobbed up at a length on the stump and he wants to pump it over midwicket with a sweep. But it dips quickly and he's not quick enough to get in position
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper's left
full on leg stump, flicked through square leg

five-for! Shakib Al Hasan, yet again. What a player. Arm ball, at a length outside off. It floats away. Najib runs down the pitch...and eventually right past the ball. No chance of coming back after missing on this attempted slog
length on middle stump, goes deep in the crease and taps into the leg side
leading edge well short of backward point. Length ball drifts into middle stump. He looks to flick and closes the face too early
length on off stump, nudges it to point's right and steals the single
length on leg stump, dropped into the leg side with soft hands
straight to midwicket. Short of a length on off stump. Gets back for the pull and it's got onto him too quickly. Feeble chip out to Mashrafe
length ball pushed across the corridor, pokes and misses
offcutter, short of a length and wide outside off. Looks to cut and gets a thick outside edge that lands short of wide slip
short of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length on middle stump, tapped into the midwicket region with soft hands
length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine
length on leg stump, pings off the inside edge as he gets forward to defend
short of a length just outside off, tapped to extra cover's right off the back foot
length ball drifted up at off stump, watchfully defended into the covers
short ball at the ribs, pulls uppishly to deep midwicket's right
length on off stump, tapped into the covers
beaten. Length ball cuts away outside off as he pokes on the front foot
thin edge says the umpire. Back of a length and angled in at middle and off. Backs away and looks to jab it down to third man. It's too much to do
length ball curving away outside off, looks to throw his hands at it and is beaten
short of a length and rising over off stump as he looks to poke through the off side
yorker just outside off, beaten as he tries to run it to third man
full on middle stump, flicked to long-on
yorker length outside off, digs this out viciously and gets it past the bowler. Shakib slides after sprinting to his right at long-off but can't stop it cleanly
bouncer at off stump, looks to pull, sliced into the empty square leg area
full and just outside off, tapped to extra cover
bowled him! Not sure if I've seen it right but Shinwari looked frustrated at the non-striker's end. Mujeeb has had a wild swing at a length ball coming into him
